dataManagement

Class MatchingSearchDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataManagement.MatchingSearchDocument

  • public class MatchingSearchDocument
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of this type is created for each document that matches a particular search; that is, a document that contains at least one of the words in the searching list.
    Author:
    pedroirivera-vega

                              int numberOfWordsToSearch)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.io.IOException
        MatchingSearchDocument constructor
        Parameters:
        docID - id of the document to search on
        numberOfWordsToSearch - numbers of words to search in the document

    • Method Detail

      • addMatchingWord

        public void addMatchingWord(java.lang.String word)
        Add a new word from the search list, which is identified as part of the document.
        Parameters:
        word - word that matched

      • buildMatchingLocations

        public void buildMatchingLocations()
        Constructs the list of all locations in the document where one of the matching words begins. For each matching word, all its locations are included as part of this list. That list is finally sorted in increasing order.

      • getMatchingWordsLocations

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> getMatchingWordsLocations()
        Get a copy of that locations in document that contain one of the words in the list of words to search
        Returns:
        the list of locations

      • calculateRank

        public void calculateRank()
        This method calculates the rank of a matched document

      • displayDocument

        public void displayDocument(int nLines)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Displays a specific number of lines from the specified document. If the number of lines is given as 0, then que whole document is displayed.
        Parameters:
        nLines - number of initial lines from the document to be displayed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - input or output error with files

      • getRank

        public float getRank()
        Gets the rank of the Matched Document
        Returns:
        the rank value;
